responses.rationale: Contains vivid language ('Screaming very loud') describing the impact (symptoms), triggering Alarmist framing.
Factual reporting using a technical/descriptive term ('dead-end infections') without explicit framing cues.
Describes viral mechanics ('pry its way into human cells') using descriptive language without explicit framing cues.
Contains an intensifier ('very') modifying a concept related to risk/rate ('change quickly'), triggering Alarmist framing.
Contains intensifiers ('very quickly', 'very easily') modifying concepts related to risk/spread, triggering Alarmist framing.
Factual comparison using descriptive language ('pretty different') without explicit framing cues.
Describes the nature of findings ('sobering findings') but does not explicitly amplify the facts themselves; defaults to Neutral.
Factual reporting of study findings ('didn't get as sick') without explicit framing cues.
Reports a hypothesis ('may depend on') using factual language without explicit framing cues.
Factual statement about viral capability ('able to infect a number of internal organs') without explicit framing cues.
Factual reporting of viral distribution in animals without explicit framing cues.
Reports agreement without explicit framing cues.
Quoted source uses explicit evaluative language ('top of the list in terms of bad guy viruses') triggering Alarmist framing.
Factual reporting of observed behaviour ('strangely or aggressively') without explicit framing cues.
Contains a vivid verb ('writhing') describing the impact (symptoms/behaviour), triggering Alarmist framing.
Reports current status and uncertainty factually without explicit framing cues.
Reports a positive fact and a comparison without explicit Alarmist or Reassuring framing cues.
